author: sauliusgrigaitis
content:
I believe we should first identify the core problemsâ€”or "themes," though a better term may existâ€”that we want to solve in Ethereum in order to succeed in such a competitive environment. Rather than focusing on specific EIPs, we need a broader, more strategic approach. A collaborative effort involving major ecosystem players, marketing teams, protocol developers, and others could help shape meaningful improvements to Ethereum as a product.

Through this process, key stakeholders would commit to adopting the outcomes of these efforts. For example, staking pools could agree to consolidate 80% of their stake within six months, assuming the consolidation mechanism is implemented in a way that aligns with their needs. This doesnâ€™t mean developers should simply build whatever individual players demandâ€”it means there should be a joint design and implementation effort between users and developers to ensure whatâ€™s shipped will be used, and this will have a great impact on Ethereum competitiveness.
